result.execSummary:
The defendant Patricia McThune was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patricia McThune

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Patricia McThune in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court heard sentencing recommendations.
Additional statements made by the defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:    THE COURT ORDERED the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 2, straight time with credit for 3 days pretrial incarceraton credit.
The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 24 MONTHS with supervision by Wisconsin Department of Corrections. 

AS TO COUNT 2:  THE COURT ORDERED the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 1, straight time with credit for 0 days pretrial incarceraton credit.  
The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 24 MONTHS with supervision by Wisconsin Department of Corrections. 

 CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 (CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* No contact with the victim, Roshanda C.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $750.00 to the victim, Roshanda C.
* PAY DNA surcharge (unless previously done) - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.

FILED, Notice or Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
filed by ADA Timothy Cotter on behalf of the State.

Defendant Patricia McThune in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.
Upon State's  motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court AMENDS the charge to two misdemeanor theft charges as follows:  
Count #1 - Theft of Movable Property [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a).  
Count #2:  Theft of Movable Property [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a).

AS TO COUNT #'s 1 & 2:    Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Parties request to adjourn the sentencing phase.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 05-08-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE WAGNER FOR JUDGE DONALD.....
Defendant Patricia McThune in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a projected plea hearing date.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 04-09-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.

Defendant Patricia McThune in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Roshanda C. or the address of 1651 N. 29th St., Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant Patricia McThune in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Defendant Patricia McThune in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
